output.final_deliverable:
I reviewed the merged results you provided. The two task nodes show that searches and plans were executed (search terms, target repositories, and steps), but the merged results do not include the actual primary-source documents, scanned newspaper pages, quotations, or specific URLs. Because your instruction requires using only evidence from searches/visits and to avoid guessing, I cannot fabricate quotes or supply URLs that were not returned in the material you merged. 

What is present in the merged material (summary of actions performed):
- Intended primary-source repositories and targets: Trove (National Library of Australia digitised newspapers), National Archives of Australia, state library digital collections, Hansard (parliamentary records), and contemporary 1932 newspapers.
- Search queries used (examples recorded in the task nodes): queries for "Great Emu War 1932 newspaper site:trove.nla.gov.au", "emu campaign 1932 'machine guns' 'soldiers' 'Campion' 'Wyalong' 'Swan' site:trove.nla.gov.au", and parliamentary/Hansard queries.
- Plan to extract verbatim quotes and capture full bibliographic metadata (publication, date, page, URL).

What is missing and why I cannot complete the requested deliverable yet:
- The merged results do not include any captured primary-source text, verbatim quotations, bibliographic metadata, or the URLs of the scanned newspapers or archive items. The nodes record search activity and intended next steps but do not contain the actual documents or links. Per your instruction to use only evidence from searches/visits and to state explicitly when evidence is missing, I must report that the necessary source texts and URLs are absent from the provided data. Therefore I cannot quote a 1932 passage or provide usable source URLs from the merged content.

Options I can take next (please choose one):
1) Run live searches and fetch sources now: I will search Trove, the National Archives of Australia, Australian War Memorial, state library collections, and reputable modern analyses (ABC, BBC, scholarly articles), extract at least one verbatim 1932 quotation with full citation, and return a consolidated list of URLs and short summaries. (I will cite each URL inline.)
2) If you prefer to supply the raw search results or URLs you already have, I will extract verbatim quotations and assemble the bibliography and analysis from those items.
3) I can prepare a detailed search plan (exact queries, likely newspapers and date ranges, and step-by-step retrieval instructions) that you or I can run later.

Recommended targets I will search if you choose option 1 (these are the repositories recorded as the planned targets in your merged results):
- Trove (National Library of Australia) digitised newspapers for 1932 contemporaneous accounts
- National Archives of Australia (records for 1932 Western Australia agricultural/military correspondence)
- Australian War Memorial / state libraries (Western Australia) for government or military reports
- Hansard / parliamentary questions in 1932 regarding emus/farmers
- Reputable modern analyses: Australian War Memorial pages, ABC News retrospectives, academic articles, and museum or library essays

Please tell me which option you want. If you choose live searching (option 1), I will proceed now and return a deliverable that includes: (a) at least one verbatim 1932 quote with full citation and URL, (b) a list of primary-source URLs and metadata, and (c) modern scholarly/reputable secondary sources with URLs and short summaries.
output.action_summary: Merged nodes show planned searches and targets (Trove, National Archives, state libraries, Hansard) and record search queries, but contain no captured primary-source texts, quotes, or URLs. I cannot quote or provide source links from the merged data because the actual documents/URLs are missing. I can either perform live searches now and fetch the primary and secondary sources with quotations and URLs, or you can supply the search results for me to extract from. Please confirm how you want to proceed.

54ade2ab-6df8-43fd-8810-d94dba20894d.title: Research the 'Great Emu War' of Australia. Find primary source documents or historical records, modern analysis of the event, and quote at least one passage from a historical document or contemporary news article about it. Provide URLs to all sources.

details.mandate: Research the 'Great Emu War' of Australia. Find primary source documents or historical records, modern analysis of the event, and quote at least one passage from a historical document or contemporary news article about it. Provide URLs to all sources.

merged_results.title: Locate primary sources and contemporary (1932) newspaper accounts of the 'Great Emu War'

result.title: Locate primary sources and contemporary (1932) newspaper accounts of the 'Great Emu War'

details.goal: Find contemporaneous primary documents and newspaper articles (1932) about the Great Emu War; extract and record at least one quoted passage from a historical document or contemporary news article and capture full citation and URL.

steps.intent: Find primary source documents, government/military records, and 1932 newspaper articles about the Great Emu War (Australia) — include Trove, National Archives of Australia, state libraries, Hansard, and contemporary papers.

queries.q: Emu War 1932 'report' 'military' 'Western Australia' site:naa.gov.au OR site:naa.gov.au.au

steps.intent: Open the most relevant Trove/newspaper pages, National Archives records, and any scanned government/military correspondence to read original language and locate quotable passages.
steps.notes: Visit trove.nla.gov.au results, National Archives of Australia item pages, state library digital collections, and scanned PDF images of original newspapers. Limit per-visit read to top 8–12 candidate results and extract text or transcribe exact quotes.

steps.intent: From the visited primary documents/newspapers, extract at least one verbatim quoted passage (with exact punctuation) from a 1932 news article or government record. Capture full citation info: publication title, date, page/issue, author (if present), and URL.
requirements: Quote must be verbatim and clearly marked (include surrounding context if necessary).
Record bibliographic metadata and stable URL for each quoted source.

steps.intent: Produce a consolidated list of all primary-source URLs and bibliographic metadata found (newspapers, government records, archives).
Store the extracted quote(s), URLs, and bibliographic metadata into memory/document store for reference and final reporting.
steps.save_format: chunked text with metadata (source, date, url)

details.parent_goal: Research the 'Great Emu War' of Australia. Find primary source documents or historical records, modern analysis of the event, and quote at least one passage from a historical document or contemporary news article about it. Provide URLs to all sources.

merged_results.title: Gather modern scholarly analyses, summaries, and reputable secondary sources about the 'Great Emu War'

result.title: Gather modern scholarly analyses, summaries, and reputable secondary sources about the 'Great Emu War'

details.goal: Locate modern analyses (scholarly articles, books, authoritative websites, museum pages, and reputable news retrospectives) that interpret the event, assess its scale and outcomes, and provide context. Collect URLs, authors, publication dates, and short abstracts/notes for each source.

steps.intent: Find academic and authoritative modern analyses of the Great Emu War: journal articles, book chapters, theses, Australian War Memorial pages, National Museum/State libraries, and established media retrospectives (ABC, BBC, Smithsonian).

Open top academic pages, museum pages (Australian War Memorial, State libraries), reputable media retrospectives, and book previews to read summaries and arguments. Extract author, date, thesis/summary, and URL.
steps.notes: Prioritize peer-reviewed sources, institutional pages (AWM, NLA), and respected media; include Wikipedia only as a pointer, not as primary evidence.

steps.intent: Summarize the main interpretations, points of agreement/disagreement among modern sources (e.g., scale, casualties, political context, whether it was a 'war' or pest-control operation), and note the most-cited secondary sources for further reference.
Produce a consolidated list of all modern-secondary URLs and bibliographic metadata found for inclusion with the primary-source list.
Store the collected URLs, summaries, and bibliographic metadata for final deliverable assembly.
steps.save_format: chunked entries with metadata and short summaries

reasons: The agent output did not provide any primary-source documents, scanned newspaper pages, verbatim quotations, or URLs as required by the task.

The output documents searches performed and planned repositories (Trove, National Archives, Hansard, state libraries) and correctly identifies the event as the 1932 Australian 'Great Emu War', showing appropriate context.

The agent explicitly refused to fabricate quotes or URLs and offered actionable next steps (run live searches, accept user-supplied results, or provide a search plan), which is useful but does not satisfy the deliverable.
No modern analysis sources or citations were included in the merged results—only a promise to search for them if option 1 is chosen.
